info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 5:32AM CDT until July 21 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
FFWLSX
The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Monroe County in southwestern Illinois... Northern Jefferson County in east central Missouri...
* Until 830 AM CDT.
* At 532 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Arnold, Festus, Eureka, Waterloo, Columbia, Pevely, Crystal City, Red Bud, Herculaneum, Hillsboro, Byrnes Mill, Barnhart, Antonia, Oakville, Mehlville, Murphy, High Ridge, Cedar Hill, Valmeyer and Cedar Hill Lakes.
This includes the following State Parks... Mastodon Historic Site, Sandy Creek Covered Bridge Historic Site and Gov. Dunklin's Grave Historic Site.
This includes Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 174 and 191.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
